    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkCheck(java.lang.String coords, chess.Piece[][] Board, int turn)
      checkCheck is to be called after every turn, this uses the findXKing methods and checks if any piece can attack the appropriate king in chess, if this is possible, it is called a check; and if it is possible, will print which king is in check.
      java.lang.String convertCoords(java.lang.String s)
      convertCoords will take in the user input, if it is of size 5 and will convert something like a1 e2 into its proper coordinates relating to the board array

      findBlackKing finds the position of the black king, to be used with check and checkmate.
      java.lang.String findWhiteKing(chess.Piece[][] Board)
      findWhiteKing finds the position of the white king, to be used with check and checkmate.

      initializeBoard does exactly what its called, at the beginning of the program, will initialize the board.

      • readNextMove

        public int readNextMove(chess.Piece[][] Board,
                        int turn)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        readNextMove is our method of asking the user for input. It also implements a turn system as you can see by the variable turn if turn % 2 == 0 then its whites move, otherwise it is blacks. If turn == -1, it signifies the game being over Further, this is where all the checking for input goes, whether the user is making a normal move, draw, or promotion entry
        Parameters:
        Board - The current game state of the board given by the Piece [][]
        turn - current value of the turn variable, used for denoting whose turn it is
        Returns:
        int - Returns an int corresponding to the next turn, to be used by the method again to determine who's turn it is.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - necessary for buffered reader

      • printCurrentBoard

        public void printCurrentBoard(chess.Piece[][] Board)
        printCurrentBoard does exactly what its called, will print the current state of the board to the console.
        Parameters:
        Board - The current game state of the board given by the Piece [][]

      • initializeBoard

        public void initializeBoard(chess.Piece[][] Board)
        initializeBoard does exactly what its called, at the beginning of the program, will initialize the board. This means populating a Piece[][] with the proper starting positions of every piece in a game of chess
        Parameters:
        Board - an empty Piece [][]

      • convertCoords

        public java.lang.String convertCoords(java.lang.String s)
        convertCoords will take in the user input, if it is of size 5 and will convert something like a1 e2 into its proper coordinates relating to the board array
        Parameters:
        s - the string given to the program by the user, should be of size 5 and look like: a1 e1
        Returns:
        String returns a string containing 4 integers, to be used later to translate into array inputs.

      • switchMethod

        public java.lang.String switchMethod(java.lang.String s)
        switchMethod is a tool to be used by convertCoords which translates what the user inputs and returns its appropriate value
        Parameters:
        s - a piece of the full coordinate string to be translated
        Returns:
        String a single integer in the form of a string "easier to be interpreted"

      • findWhiteKing

        public java.lang.String findWhiteKing(chess.Piece[][] Board)
        findWhiteKing finds the position of the white king, to be used with check and checkmate.
        Parameters:
        Board - The current game state of the board given by the Piece [][]
        Returns:
        String The location of the White King

      • findBlackKing

        public java.lang.String findBlackKing(chess.Piece[][] Board)
        findBlackKing finds the position of the black king, to be used with check and checkmate.
        Parameters:
        Board - The current game state of the board given by the Piece [][]
        Returns:
        String The location of the Black King

      • checkCheck

        public void checkCheck(java.lang.String coords,
                       chess.Piece[][] Board,
                       int turn)
        checkCheck is to be called after every turn, this uses the findXKing methods and checks if any piece can attack the appropriate king in chess, if this is possible, it is called a check; and if it is possible, will print which king is in check.
        Parameters:
        coords - the location of the king being checked
        Board - The current game state of the board given by the Piece [][]
        turn - the current turn
